description: Any insight into why my local detect-secrets scan command is finding a secret, but the review doc action isn't picking it up?
title: detect-secrets and reviewdog actionnot syncing up

description:
in react native , I am building a students app and when the students use it they need to insert a code or token to unlock the content of it how I can do that , notice the code will be printed on cards and the people who want it can buy it from teacher for example .

I need a way to generate token or some libraries that can do the thing just I need a token and validate it in the app to open the content for that person and then the token will be only used once and the app will open forever .
title: is there any way to generate tokens

description:
I am developing an online store website on WordPress. I am using the "simla" plugin for WooCommerce. This plugin generates an ICML catalog. I want to make sure that the barcode of the product gets into this file as a standard property. I contacted the support of this plugin and they told me that in order to do this, I need to make changes to the plugin code: “In order to transfer the barcode from the site as a standard product property, you will need to make changes to the catalog generation code.” . Could you suggest me how to do this?

I read the documentation, but no luck.
title: How to transfer a barcode from the site, as a standard product property, in the WooCommerce plugin?

description: I have a text composed of text fragments delimited by "[1]" tags. I would like to use regular expressions to select (and eventually delete) those delimited fragments that do not contain asterisks.
title: How to capture a multi-line regex between two tags based on a match condition?

description:
I am trying to host a static Angular site on AWS S3, but I am encountering a CORS policy issue. When I try to view the index.html file after running ng build, I get the following error:

Access to script at '.../dist/testapp/runtime-es2015.js' from origin 'null' has been blocked by CORS policy: Cross origin requests are only supported for protocol schemes: http, data, isolated-app, chrome-extension, chrome-untrusted, https, edge.

I am not finding much documentation on how this works in the first place, as Angular generally needs a server to run on. Can someone help me understand how to resolve this CORS policy issue and host a static Angular site on AWS S3?
title: CORS policy issue while trying to host a static Angular site on AWS S3
